page.title: 04BISHOPS BEFORE THE WAR
page.content: After the 1914 war times were very hard. {Agriculture}was the main employment. Most men and women were employed by the{Greaves Bull and Lakin {Cement Works.}They were also employed by the gentry of the village, Mr. Lakin of Pipers Hill, Captain Spencer of the Cottage, and Mr. Clark of the Manor House Farm. Most people had large gardens. They kept pigs and poultry. Women went leasing at harvest time to get as much corn and straw as possible to help feed their poultry and fatten cockerals for Christmas. Two pigs were killed a year, one in{December making extra food for{Christmas. }The bacon and hams were salted and hung up to dry. There were good joints of ballrib and sparerib for roasting.
